title: COVID-19 Vaccine
description: Hy-Vee offers the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines where available. Sign up to receive vaccine updates or schedule your appointment soon.
cleaned_text: Who can get vaccinated as of today? Review below to learn which COVID-19 vaccine you are eligible to receive today. Pfizer-BioNTech (Comirnaty), Moderna (Spikevax) and Novavax COVID-19 vaccines are available at Hy-Vee Pharmacy locations. Questions? Contact your local Hy-Vee Pharmacy or primary medical provider. Timeline for General Population Timeline for Moderately to Severely Immunocompromised Population How to Schedule Your COVID-19 Vaccination(s) COVID-19 vaccinations are available at all Hy-Vee Pharmacy locations. Schedule via: Phone If you need assistance scheduling your vaccination, call [888-330-3307](tel:888-330-3307) What to Bring to Your Vaccination Appointment - Insurance card* and Medicare Part B red, white and blue card (if Medicare recipient) - Photo ID (recommended) - COVID-19 vaccination record card (if applicable) *Only required for those enrolled in health insurance. Those who are not covered by insurance can still receive the COVID-19 vaccine at no cost. **Individuals receiving an additional dose (for immunocompromised) of the COVID-19 vaccine will need to self-attest to their eligibility. Individuals will NOT be required to show documentation to prove eligibility. Side Effects According to the CDC, patients can expect to experience mild side effects from the vaccines. Common side effects include pain or swelling in the arm where the vaccine was administered, fever, chills, tiredness and headache. Symptoms should be temporary and are expected to go away in a few days. Other potential side effects will vary depending on the specific vaccine. [Visit the CDC website](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines.html) for further information. If redness or tenderness where you received the vaccine increases after 24 hours, or if you are worried about any other side effects, contact your health care provider immediately. Frequently Asked Questions References: Find an appointment or sign up to receive COVID-19 related news and updates More Hy-Vee COVID-19 Resources Register for a COVID-19 test, available at select Hy-Vee pharmacies.
